metadata.title: CVE-2017-11112 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - negligible
metadata.description:
In ncurses 6.0, there is an attempted 0xffffffffffffffff access in theappend_acs function of tinfo/parse_entry.c. It could lead to a remotedenial of service attack if the terminfo library code is used to processuntrusted terminfo data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11112` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lib32ncurses5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
lib32ncursesw5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
lib32tinfo5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
lib64ncurses5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
lib64tinfo5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libncurses5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libncursesw5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libtinfo5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libx32ncurses5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libx32ncursesw5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libx32tinfo5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
ncurses-base - 6.1-1ubuntu1
ncurses-bin - 6.1-1ubuntu1
ncurses-examples - 6.1-1ubuntu1
ncurses-term - 6.1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ncurses package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.1-1ubuntu1').
